captions.text:
Previously on the Disney Car Toys Channel.
Barbie came over to Elsa's castle and dyed

her hair brown. I got a lot of comments asking
me how did i do that? And so today i am going

to show you the magical secret of how to color
your Barbies hair. And if you haven't done

so please subscribe to my channel so you can
watch cool Frozen and Barbie videos like these.

To transform Elsa from a blond to a brunette,
all you need are some sharpies paper and an

Elsa doll. The Sharpie i'm using is a brown
permanent mark so be really careful with it

it does stain and this wont wash out. Make
sure to use the brown sharpie and not a black

one, the black on will change her hair more
into a black purple color, and it wont look

as good. and i have three sharpies here because
it actually uses a lot of ink. I also have

about three or four pieces of paper and i
am going to use the paper to color Elsa's

hair on. You want to make sure you don't get
any maker on you table or anything. So what

you do is literally color her hair, its almost
like painting a picture. For her bangs you

really want to be careful, you don't want
to accidentally color her forehead or anything.

And if you accidentally do you want to really
wash that off right away this is permanent.

So be pretty careful. S we will move on to
coloring the top of her head.I will go back

to the bangs a little later. I am going to
color it on the paper. And that will ensure

i don't color that on her forehead. Now one
thing you definitely need to do before you

do anything else is ask your mom if you could
color your dolls hair. My mom would have super

mad if i would have colored my dolls hair,
when i was younger so definitely ask your

mom first. And i would also recommend practicing
on a Barbie you don't like so much. That's

what i did first, I had a Barbie head that
fell of the doll so i practiced on the doll

with a missing head first. And then i did
it on Elsa's hair. No i am going to go back

to Elsa's bangs here i am putting on the paper
just to make sure i am not coloring her face

accidentally. And her bangs you really want
to make sure to get the top and bottom. and

do a good job. That's why i am doing it on
the paper. And there we go it looks good.

Elsa's crown is kind of getting in the way
here so if your Elsa doll still has her crown

on. Just grab some scissors and clip it off.
there we go. now look at those brown roots.

Now with Elsa's crown off this is going to
be much easier. Another thing i would recommend

is maybe doing this on a Barbie doll If you
only have one Elsa doll. I have a couple Elsa

dolls and Elsa dolls i am starting to see
more in the stores lately. It used to be you

never ever saw them in stores. I actually
went to the grocery store the other day and

there was like fifteen Elsa dolls, like what.
So i bought one and then i was like what on

earth do i do with this thing? Um because
i already have two Elsa dolls, i really don't

need three. But I'm kinda scared of having
my Elsa doll get ruined when i throw her in

the pool or in the bath tube so i like to
have a back ups. But i was like Maybe i will

color her hair because i'm a brunette and
i always kind of wondered what Elsa would

look like as a brunette. And we will know.
you can see i finished the top of her head.

Now i am going to color her braid and her
braid you know is pretty think so I'm kinda

of doing a quick run through on the top layer
of her hair. And then i will just keep on

coloring just so we make sure all the blond
is covered. Okay lets take a quick breather.

You can see i have her front colored pretty
well so you can get a good look of what Elsa

looks like as a brunette. her braid in the
back is still pretty blind though so we will

continue coloring. There still is so much
more to color here so i'm going to have to

put it on super speed. i don't want to bore
you by playing a 40 minute video of me coloring

Elsa's hair so i'm going to put it on super
speed. I'm going to cut some of it out to.

Not you want to make sure to get the front
and the back of the braid. it looks like a

small braid but there is a lot to color here.
After you have the front of the braid colored

it is actually easier to just lye her down
and color the back and i have throughout switched

my Sharpie i think i have used to make this
about two Sharpie's so you do use a lot of ink

here and you do get a little bit of the marker on your
hands. And it kind of smells bad to so if

you feel light headed from breathing in the
Sharpie take a break. Um probably actually

the hardest part is the bottom of the pony
tail here because there is just so much hair.

And now Elsa is transformed she is officially
a brunette and looking cute. Here's Elsa as

a blond again very very light blond hair And
here she is as a brunette so what do you think?

Do you like Elsa more as a blond or brunette.
Let me know. And also if you enjoyed this

video please like.Click on a picture to watch
another fun toy video. Thanks for watching
and have a great day!

title: Frozen Elsa with BROWN HAIR!!! Part 2 How To ★ Elsa as a Brunette Salon & Makeover DisneyCarToys
